Issues.Title: Separate the WindowsDesktop SDK from the WPF runtime
Issues.Body:
The WindowsDesktop SDK needs to be removed from the WPF runtime and placed in its own branch to prepare it for inclusion in the dotnet/SDK repo.  

In addition to the entire PresentationBuildTasks project, these files must also be included:

src\Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf\src\Common

Issues.Body:
**Application Name:**  ControlzEx (DiscordChatExporter failed with similar error code CS8601)
**OS:** Windows 10 RS5
**CPU:** X64
**.NET Build Number:** 6.0.100-preview.1.21071.10

**Verify Scenarios:**

2). Windows 10 RS5 X64 + .NET Core SDK build 5.0.102: Pass

**Repro steps**
Source code is targeting netcoreapp3.1 and net6.0-windows, global.json set to 6.0.100-preview.1.21075.3

Issues.Title: MenuItem: CommandParameters are ignored
Issues.Body:
- .NET Core Version: 5
- Windows version: 20H2

## Problem description:

I created an MVVM sample repository. In this repository I'm loading [`MenuItem`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/system.windows.controls.menuitem)s and [`Button`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/system.windows.controls.button)s with commands.

While the `Button` elements call `ICommand::Execute(object? parameter)` with the given `CommandParameter`, `MenuItem` elements don't.

Here's a code snipped showing both declarations:

```xml
<MenuItem Header="Film_liste" ItemsSource="{Binding Path=Commands}">
    <MenuItem.ItemTemplate>
      <DataTemplate>
        <MenuItem Command="{Binding}" CommandParameter="{Binding ElementName=Filmliste, Path=SelectedItem}" Header="{Binding Path=Text}" />
      </DataTemplate>
    </MenuItem.ItemTemplate>
  </MenuItem>

  ...

  <ItemsControl.ItemTemplate>
    <DataTemplate>
      <Button Command="{Binding}" CommandParameter="{Binding ElementName=Filmliste, Path=SelectedItem}" Content="{Binding Path=Text}" Margin="5" Padding="10 3"></Button>
    </DataTemplate>
  </ItemsControl.ItemTemplate>
```
 
## Actual behavior:

Commands triggered by `MenuItem` elements are always passed `null` as command parameter.
 
## Expected behavior:

Commands triggered by `MenuItem` elements should be passed the value provided as command parameter.
 
## Minimal repro:

[MVVM Test repository](/SetTrend/MVVM-Test)

## Steps to reproduce:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/105822923-da8b8880-5fbc-11eb-9c90-e665297a710a.mp4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MenuItem: CommandParameters are ignored" (#4078)

Issues.Title: [master] Update dependencies from dotnet/winforms
Issues.Body:
This pull request updates the following dependencies

[marker]: <> (Begin:Coherency Updates)
## Coherency Updates

Issues.Title: [508 Accessibility] Support changing the spelling wavy underline color to accommodate color vision impairment
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
* Windows version: (`winver`) Windows 10
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
The current red underline color for misspelled words is not easily visible for some types of color blindness, so we need to support a way of changing the color. This can be especially bad in dark theme. 

MS Office supports customization through a regkey (SpellingWavyUnderlineColor): https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/925597/how-to-customize-the-color-of-the-spelling-and-grammar-checker-underli
But it doesn't get respected by WPF.

Looking at the WPF source it looks like this is hard-coded to red:
https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/d49f8ddb889b5717437d03caa04d7c56819c16aa/src/Microsoft.DotNet.Wpf/src/PresentationFramework/System/Windows/Documents/SpellerHighlightLayer.cs#L153

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73407322/105772144-96de4380-5f16-11eb-97a3-9b4347429c67.png)

 **Expected behavior:**
 
 **Minimal repro:**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[508 Accessibility] Support changing the spelling wavy underline color to accommodate color vision impairment" (#4075)

Issues.Title: RTL Maldivian/Dhivehi (Thaana) text is not displayed correctly in WPF textboxes
Issues.Body:
* Windows version: (`winver`) Windows 10
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
When inputting certain right-to-left language scripts in a WPF text box with an English OS, the characters are reversed.

Issue is reproducible with certain right-to-left languages, like Dhivehi/Thaana and Uyghur/Uighur Arabic, but not others like Hebrew and Arabic.

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
Reversed text (incorrect)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73407322/105753131-1101ce80-5efd-11eb-8841-6f3fcbc6403f.png)

 **Expected behavior:**
Correct Text: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73407322/105753175-1e1ebd80-5efd-11eb-9d13-beb083edd28a.png)
 
 **Minimal repro:**
1. In a simple WPF application, copy the text `ތާނަ` from [Wiki page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thaana),
2. Observe that Thaana script is shown reversed
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/73407322/105753499-a4d39a80-5efd-11eb-8beb-459b2f537a4b.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "RTL Maldivian/Dhivehi (Thaana) text is not displayed correctly in WPF textboxes" (#4074)

Issues.Title: IncludePackageReferencesDuringMarkupCompilation has no effect in VB projects
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version:
- Version:   5.0.200-preview.20614.14
- Commit:    863605c8c3
- Visual Studio 16.9 preview 3
* Windows version: 10.0.18363
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No. This is a bug of a new feature of .NET 5 .
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No. This bug is reproducible with .NET CLI.

 **Problem description:**
The generated code of VB source generators in WPF projects can't be accessed directly, even if I add `<IncludePackageReferencesDuringMarkupCompilation>true</IncludePackageReferencesDuringMarkupCompilation>` to `<PropertyGroup>` . The generated code can be used with reflection. So, I guess `MainWindow.xaml.vb` was built before running VB code generators.

 **Actual behavior:** 
The source files generated by VB source generators can be used directly.

 **Expected behavior:**
The source files generated by VB source generators can **NOT** be used directly. They can only be used by using reflection.

 **Minimal repro:**
- Clone https://github.com/Nukepayload2/MyWpfExtensionGenerator
- Open `Nukepayload2.SourceGenerators.MyWpfExtension.sln` with Visual Studio 16.9 preview 3
- Build project `Nukepayload2.SourceGenerators.MyWpfExtension`
- Reload the solution
- In the `SampleNet5WpfAndWinforms` project, open `MainWindow.xaml.vb`. You will not see any build errors.
- Build the `SampleNet5WpfAndWinforms` project with Visual Studio or .NET CLI. You will see build errors in the output window or the console window.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "IncludePackageReferencesDuringMarkupCompilation has no effect in VB projects" (#4073)

Issues.Title: Setting IncludePackageReferencesDuringMarkupCompilation with a custom BaseIntermediateOutputPath causes build to fail
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 5.0.102
 
 **Problem description:**
I tried following the suggestion in #3963 in order to pull in a source generator nuget to a wpf project.  Upon doing so (setting `IncludePackageReferencesDuringMarkupCompilation` to `true`), my build fails with the following:

```
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\5.0.102\Sdks\Microsoft.NET.Sdk\targets\Microsoft.PackageDependencyResolution.targets(241,5):
error NETSDK1004: Assets file 'C:\Dev\pkgref-bugs\Objects\wpf-app_smqwgw3w_wpftmp\project.assets.json' not found.
Run a NuGet package restore to generate this file. [C:\Dev\pkgref-bugs\wpf-app\wpf-app_smqwgw3w_wpftmp.csproj]
```
 
I noticed that if I stop using a custom `BaseIntermediateOutputPath` for my projects, then I'm able to build successfully.

 **Expected behavior:**
I should be able to use source generators with wpf applications and use a custom `BaseIntermediateOutputPath`
 
 **Minimal repro:**
- Add a package reference to a source generator in a wpf project
- Set the `IncludePackageReferencesDuringMarkupCompilation` property to be true
- Create a `Directory.Build.props` file to set `BaseIntermediateOutputPath`.  I used `..\Objects\$(MSBuildProjectName)`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Setting IncludePackageReferencesDuringMarkupCompilation with a custom BaseIntermediateOutputPath causes build to fail" (#4067)

Issues.Title: .Net Core 3.0/.Net Framework WPF Resource in C# shared items project
Issues.Body:
Hello,
I have a c# shared items project, between a .net core and .net framework wpf app.  And trying to share an image as follows in the shared .projitems. Both main projects dont' seem to pick this up. In fact, the IDE shows a disable status for each file. IDE seems to light up if it's a 'content' file.

```
Contents of .projitems ..

  <ItemGroup>
    <Resource Include="$(MSBuildThisFileDirectory)Images\Background.jpg" />
    <Resource Include="$(MSBuildThisFileDirectory)Images\Checkbox_checked.png" />
  </ItemGroup>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".Net Core 3.0/.Net Framework WPF Resource in C# shared items project" (#4066)
